text:
e="preserve">Buffalo Wild Wings (nicknamed B-Dubs) is an American casual dining restaurant franchise. The restaurant does business in the United States, Canada, Mexico, India, Panama, the Philippines and several other countries.
The company was founded in 1982. It was originally called Buffalo Wild Wings & Weck.
As of June 2017, the company had 1,238 locations in all 50 states and the District of Columbia.
The company's headquarters is in Sandy Springs, Georgia. Sandy Springs is home to its parent company, Inspire Brands, which is just north of Atlanta. The brand runs its support center from Minneapolis, Minnesota.
The chain is best known for buffalo wings and for other items, such as chicken tenders and legs.
